items.title: Israel Recovers Body of Ran Gvili From Gaza, Closing a Chapter

items.title: Thousands of Flights Canceled Monday After Snowstorm

items.title: As U.S. Warships Get Closer, Iran Ramps Up Threats to Retaliate

items.title: The Taliban Say They’re Ready to Release U.S. Prisoners. But Which Ones?

items.title: Winter Storm Pummels Toronto With Record Snowfall
items.content_html: Canada’s biggest city got roughly 22 inches, and giant snow banks are unlikely to melt soon because of colder than usual temperatures.
items.content_text: Canada’s biggest city got roughly 22 inches, and giant snow banks are unlikely to melt soon because of colder than usual temperatures.

items.title: Gunmen Kill 11 After Soccer Match in Mexico

items.title: Russia Says Talks to End War in Ukraine Will Continue

items.title: In Xi’s China, Top General’s Fall Shows Precariousness of Power

items.title: In Venezuela, Freeing the Economy, but Nothing Else

items.title: Shift to Drone Fighting in Ukraine War Means No Winter Lull

items.title: Xi’s Purge of China’s Military Brings Its Top General Down

items.title: Trump Threatens Canada With Tariffs as Post-Davos Fallout Continues

items.title: William H. Foege, Key Figure in the Eradication of Smallpox, Dies at 89
items.content_html: His containment strategy helped wipe out the disease in the 1970s, one of the world’s greatest public health triumphs. He also led the C.D.C. and promoted childhood vaccination worldwide.

items.title: Australian Boy, 12, Dies After Shark Attack Near Sydney

items.title: An Unlikely Source of Crypto Innovation: Afghanistan

items.title: Under Pressure from Trump, Venezuela Agrees to Accept More U.S. Deportation Flights

items.title: Russia Jails U.S. Navy Veteran for Five Years

items.title: Trump’s Turnabout on Greenland Shows the Limits of His Coercive Powers
items.content_html: President Trump’s faith in his ability to wring concessions by taking maximalist positions was on full display this week. So were the costs, as he splintered NATO and then undercut his credibility by climbing down from his threats.

items.title: Prosecutors in Spain End Investigation Into Julio Iglesias
items.content_html: Two women accused the singer, 82, of abusing them in the Caribbean and filed a complaint in Spain, but Spanish officials said that they did not have jurisdiction over the claim.
